name: Swiss Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone mentioned, this place is a great find. It's within walking distance to most Ottawa attractions, very clean and extremely comfortable, with a great breakfast. The owner is super friendly and very helpful. Our room had a sitting area and there were chocolates and champagne on ice when we arrived. The only negative is that there is not enough parking for all guests so we had to use street parking. There is normally plenty of street parking though.
reviews.title: Would gladly return!

reviews.text: We actually happened upon Gasthaus Switzerland about 10 years ago. It has only gotten better with time. The owners, Sabina and Josef have always been friendly and accommodating as has the house staff. Never once have I felt like I made mistake staying here. It's great that it's so close to the Byward Market, restaurants and the grocery store and pretty much most of the attractions are within walking distance. We come in the winter also and I love it that it's not far from the canal at all. After a cold day of skating and a warm dinner somewhere in Ottawa, it's great to settle into the beds which are the most comfortable beds I've every stayed in away from home. The comforters just wrap around you like a big hug! Because we've stayed here a few times, we've had different rooms. Every one of them has been clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Absolutely love this Inn!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Actually, I'm pretty surprised to read some of the negative reviews on this site. I have stayed at many B&Bs around the world. This one is up there with the best! The breakfast has a varied array of delicious treats. Try the muesli...it's yummy!
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.text: It's great place all in all and I look forward to going back this winter!
reviews.title: Home away from home
What a great place!
reviews.text: Nice location, short walk to the square. Street was relatively quiet (i.e. - college was not in session) except for the construction on the next building beginning both mornings shortly after 8 am.

When I first arrived at the Gasthaus Switzerland Inn, I wasn't too sure if I had made the right choice. I walked a strange way from the Rideau Centre bus stop down a fairly unsavoury street, and when I arrived at around 11 in the morning the downstairs reception was dark and empty.
reviews.title: Little Gem in Ottawa

likes.liked: — Knowledgeable and friendly host, and an awesome breakfast!

reviews.text: However, I left my bags and returned at 3pm - the earliest time you can check in. And I was very glad I did! My room - the cheapest available - was prettily decorated and perfectly adequate in size for one person for a short stay. The bed was perfectly comfortable and the bathroom adequate. I think there are much nicer rooms available, but you get what you pay for, and my room had no real faults, it was just fairly basic. But the reason I would call this place a little gem is because of the owner - Sabina. She is a real character and very happy to help with advice. She will make your stay memorable no matter how short it is!
reviews.title: Memorable Weekend Get-a-way

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything that I could complain about..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other reasons to stay here are a convenient location, within an easy walk of Parliament Hill for sightseeing and the Byward Market for eating out or shopping. But the best reason of all is the breakfast! Excellent swiss coffee, homemade Bircher muesli (which might look like a bowl of wallpaper paste with rapsberries on top but is one of the most delicious breakfasts I have ever eaten), a large selction of breads and pastries, fresh fruit, cheeses - wonderful!
reviews.title: It depends on your expectations...

reviews.text: If I go back to Ottawa, which is not top on my list of things to do, I would stay here again. You can probably find more luxurious accomodations, but for personal service, charm and value for money this place is a good bet.
reviews.title: "A genuine European hospitality with a wonderful aura"

likes.liked: — The cozy and atmosphere, location, the HOSTS
likes.disliked: — I had no problems at all. Maybe if a check-in was allowed earlier that would be nice...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B & B was amazing! Sabina and the staff were very helpful when asking where to go for dinner and giving directions. The location was very central and we could walk everywhere we wanted, including the Byward Market, Parliament Buildings, and the Rideau Center. On a rainy day Sabina lent us an umbrella, and when we had to check out the early she packed us some fruit and drinks for the trip, as we left before breakfast was served. The bedding was soft and comfortable, and we enjoyed the wireless internet.
reviews.title: good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gasthaus Switzerland Inn is a wonderful B&B in downtown Ottawa. The host’s utmost dedication to their business is felt through their warm treatment of their guests – we felt right at home! Being in Ottawa for the first time, Sabina, one of the owners, was gracious to direct us to all of the interesting places to go in the city and with the superb location of the B&B, everywhere was just a short walk! Furthermore, our room was clean and comfortable and the delicious breakfast by the large stone fireplace in their beautiful new dining room gave us a great start to our day.
reviews.title: A Great Experience!

reviews.text: Ottawa is a great city and Gasthaus Switzerland is a great place – we are coming back soon!
reviews.title: felt like i was in europe again

likes.liked: — very clean, modern and up to date.
likes.disliked: — what i liked least..? maybe that i couldnt stay any longer.

reviews.text: I spent a few days at the Gasthaus after spending 5 weeks in Quebec (some intensive French immersion training). To sum up my stay - it was amazing. I normally don't review hotels in my home country but I felt this one was a step above the rest so I should give it the credit it deserves. My first night was brief, but very, very comfortable. The beds were amazing. I think it may be the Swiss pillows and mattress, whatever it was, I slept like I had never slept before. This was quite nice considering I had just traveled 10 hours on a train.
reviews.title: Great place in Ottawa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at quite a few Inn's when I traveled through Europe in 2004 and loved most of them. I felt the exact same atmosphere at the Gasthaus. Bright and early in the morning after I had awakened I went downstairs to see a nicely laid out breakfast, which included juices, breads, cheeses and most importantly - Muesli. I probably ate 5 or 6 bowls on my first day it was so good, and that is probably an understatement. Nonetheless Sabina (your housekeeper) just kept feeding it to me! I felt like I was at home, away from home.
reviews.title: Pokey and Noisy
excellent Inn
reviews.text: There is plenty of space to hang out while you're there. There is a computer (a nice one, not some crappy passed down thing) with free internet, and access was always available. I know they have free Wi-Fi as well if you bring your laptop (nice for the rooms). I spent most of my time on the patio (see pictures) and in the dining room. It was a real pleasurable experience because I was able to conversate with so many different people and they were all so happy.

I stayed in this hotel after a friend advises. I arrived at 8:00 PM and left the next day. I cannot recall a worse treatment in any other hotel that I have stayed in my life. The receptionist was very unwelcoming in the first day. She did not explain where to park the car and she did not tell me that they have there own parking.
reviews.title: Do not stay in this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She yelled at me the next day because I rang the bell at 7:00 AM, which is half hour before the check out time. I did ring the bell due to an urgent matter to check out earlier.
reviews.title: OK but not worth another stay.

reviews.text: It is located near downtown, but not nice area.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: I do not advice you to stay if you are there for business, unless you do not care about services.
reviews.title: Wonderful accommodation

reviews.text: This is the second time in 2 years my wife and I stayed at this establishment but won't return because of a bad experience with our "included" breakfast on our second day. We were virtually ignored by the wait staff. I got fed up and left while my wife stayed to finish her dry bagel. (no coffee was offered, no butter on the table,no greeting, but staff were busy chatting in another room.) Rooms are small but clean, and quiet. Parking is included which is a plus, but there are only 5 spaces available for 22 rooms. They do not accept payment by debit card, and they won't allow you inside the building until the 3:00 PM check in time.(so don't arrive early)
reviews.title: a more than happy guest at the Gasthaus Switzerland

description: Seamlessly blending modern European design with late 19th century Canadian architecture, Swiss Hotel is the perfect combination of old and new. Whether you're coming to town for business or pleasure, the Swiss Hotel is the best choice for any trip to Ottawa.Swiss Hotel has 22 cozy rooms with and i-Pad in every room and Free internet. Optional European buffet breakfast available for $15 per person. Located in the heart of the city within walking distance to all major tourist attractions, only steps from the Ottawa Convention Centre, University of Ottawa, ByWard Market, Parliament Hill, National Gallery of Canada and the best Ottawa has to offer, it provides a unique hotel experience.
